Reviews.Title: “Fairly standard - nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: Gemsybob
Reviews.Content: This is a Super 8, like every other Super 8. It was clean and comfortable, the room was nice, and the parking was good. Best thing was the staff member, who was able to give us a good recommendation on somewhere to eat. Probably wouldn't stay again, but because of the area (we chose it for proximity to the airport) rather than the motel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: Chidders
Reviews.Content: We had a great 4 night stay here. The room was large and quiet and well maintained. The parking was easy and convenient, and the breakfast was satisfactory & also quiet, thoguh we did get up early! For us it was perfect and would totally recommend. However, a word of waring, there is nothing in walking distance & no local restaurants or bars, so if you want close by ngihtlife this is not the place for you. However, we were out early in the morning sightseeing and would get back early evening and just crash out!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: Stuart T
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with the super8 motel. Cheap and cheerful. Room was clean and tidy, and close to some good restaurants and bars. Staff were very friendly, and good parking.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest Super 8 I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: saraaarons
Reviews.Content: The only problem with this hotel was that the rate changed upon arrival. My mother & I booked this on Hotwire.com. When we arrived we were told the rate given to us was for only one bed & a room with 2 beds would be $30 more. Just because you book for 2 people doesn't mean you both want to sleep in the same bed. We stayed 5 nights so with taxes & the extra $30 per night we almost paid an additional $200 than anticipated. Good customer service would have been to honor the original rate. Besides that, the hotel was very nice & clean. The atmosphere was quiet. The breakfast was good & staff was very friendly in the morning. I really like the open sunroom breakfast area. We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Cheap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajhoyden
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel every time I'm in the area. The rooms are clean and quiet and come with amenities that don't usually show up in $70 (You have to find the right discounts.) hotels in the LA area. The beds are comfortable. The rooms are large. The staff are efficient and professional. The online booking is easy. And the parking, breakfast, and coffee are free. Overall an excellent deal and it's not that far from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “a good deal on a decent room”
Reviews.Author: schnep
Reviews.Content: While the immediate surroundings aren't particular charming, the hotel itself feels safe and is clean. The rooms have been updated, and mine was in good repair. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to someone without a car, but if you DO have one, there are lots of good restaurants and shopping areas within just a few minutes of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, sketchy area”
Reviews.Author: A G
Reviews.Content: The area was a little sketchy. We did laundry across the street and saw a couple of search helicopters. It was kind of scary. The motel itself was great, very clean and quiet rooms. Good breakfast too. I wouldn't stay here again only because of the area, the motel itself was great.

Reviews.Title: “Super Value”
Reviews.Author: ka7890
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a night and almost a full day to spend in LA before making a connection for an overseas flight. We didn't want to spend a lot of money so we decided to give this Super 8 a chance. We paid $81 for one night. We were very pleasantly surprised by the motel. It offers free off-street parking, clean rooms, and a friendly attendant. Admittedly, the free breakfast wasn't much but the coffee, juice, and individually wrapped danish was enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value with Great Service and Amenities!”
Reviews.Author: HalfMarathonGirl
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 1 week stay in the Los Angeles area and this was the best hotel I have stayed at in a long while! The room was spotless from the carpet to the sheets and bedspread to the small appliances. No odors and the room was spacious! The shower/tub had plenty of hot water and great water pressure. Our king-sized bed was comfortable. The air/heat worked well in our room and the temperature was always at the setting we desired. The coffeemaker, refrigerator and microwave helped us keep the eating-out expenses to a minimum. There was an iron, ironing board, hairdryer, alarm clock and nice television with remote. Everything functioned appropriately. There was free internet service. The parking lot was secure with plenty of spaces-free. It was too cold for swimming but the pool area was neat and clean even for the off-season. The free continental breakfast was very basic but adequate for us with cold cereals, milk, coffee, juice, etc. The area for breakfast in the lobby was small with 2 chairs for each of the 2 tables there but we preferred staying in our room to eat anyway. The staff was very helpful and friendly, especially the young man in the late evening. He helped us with directions and picking out things to do while in the area. He even called me one evening to let me know I had left my car lights on. The motel does not allow smoking or pets. We were on the lower level in Room 115. It was very quiet and we rarely heard any noise from the upstairs level. The housekeeping staff stocked our room daily with shampoo, conditioner, lotion, razor, shave lotion, toothpaste and toothbrush, and did a great job with keeping the room neat. For all the amenities and the area, I thought the total price (including tax) of $508 was great! I probably won't be going back to LA anytime soon but you can bet that if I do, I'll stay here again! I was very pleased with the service and accommodations!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: angelfish28
Reviews.Content: We came to the LA area for a weekend (wedding) and chose to stay here for its proximity to our destinations, as well as the reasonable price. Honestly I was hesitant to stay at a Super 8 as I haven't heard great stories in the past, and I didn't know anything about the neighborhood. We were pleasantly surprised about the cleanliness of the rooms, and the immaculate parking lot, and the safe area. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “good location but terrible attitude and service”
Reviews.Author: alpanadm
Reviews.Content: the location of the property is excellent if you want to get around to doing the usual touristy stuff in LA. But for some reason the people at the front desk have a serious bad attitude problem. Forget about a smile they are close to being rude. We had stayed at the super 8, la mesa at san diego just a night before and the Indian owner at the desk was delightful and knowledgble. walking into culver city was just the other way round. The check in clerk was ignorant and rude. The breakfast was below par. They had exactly 2 things of which also the bread ran out and on being asked was given an answer by the lady that just do without it! Disinterested owners. The good part was that the location was fabulous and the rooms superbly sized and good.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended Bargain Lodging In Culver City”
Reviews.Author: panoramarick
Reviews.Content: When I went for an overnight business trip in Venice Beach, California, I knew I’d have little time in my room so why spend $150 to over $200 a night, I asked myself. I found the Super 8 hotel in Culver City online and it had good reviews. I decided to give it a try, and I’ve very glad I did. This particular location in Culver City is on a busy corner and not a tourist area, but the owners have gone to great lengths to make this a very comfortable stay at a great price. We had a king suite and it was spacious and comfortable. The paint looked new and was tasteful, there was crown moulding on the ceiling, the furniture was comfortable and in good condition, the bedding was crisp and clean and comfortable. I was amazed that the bathroom amenities even included a shaving razor and packet of shaving cream, toothbrush and toothpaste. I didn’t get to try it but there was an interesting BBQ restaurant directly across the street. Looked like my kind of place. Maybe next time... The pool was adequate for a refreshing dip. Breakfast was cold cereal, toast and bagels, some fruit, packaged pastries, coffee and juice. Despite the traffic outside our room was quiet and we enjoyed our stay. What else is there to say? If you want a budget room in the Culver City/Venice Beach area, you should give the Super 8 serious consideration. It is obvious that the owners are going all the way to make this a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good LA motel that's not on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Paul W
Reviews.Content: The motel, which is located in a semi-industrial part of LA, is relatively quiet in spite of the heavy traffic on Washington Blvd. It is also ideally located by car in relation to the beaches and waterfronts of the South Bay (Manhattan, Hermosa, Redondo, etc.) as well as those of Venice and Santa Monica. The combination of a microwave and refrigerator in every room is a nice touch. The room service, while not always prompt, was generally thorough. All in all, it provides good value for the price, which is much lower than that of comparable quality lodgings in the same general area. Parking is free and plentiful too.

Reviews.Title: “Black hairs stuck in the white towels”
Reviews.Author: Moose707
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to stay at for 6 nights. We left after the first night after finding black curly hairs (possibly pubic?) inbedded in the bath towels. This is inexcusible, and my boyfriend and I promptly left the next day as it was too late to go somewhere else. The other people staying in the rooms near ours were shady to the say the least. One looked to be doing a deal. At least we did not have a problem getting a refund. Not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Little Hotel That Could”
Reviews.Author: ZIALANDER
Reviews.Content: I was not familiar with the Super 8 brand before staying here. I figured two notches above Motel 6. I was wrong. I needed a place to stay for a week while in Los Angeles. On my last visit to LA I stayed at Travelodge and the experience was so-so. Super 8 far surpassed my expectations. It is tucked away on busy Washington Blvd yet very very quiet. I really liked the fact that parking was ample even on a Friday night [not so at Travelodge]. I was in room 129, in the back on the 2nd level [no elevator so pack lite]. The location in West LA/Culver City is perfect: not far from the airport and near Fox Hills Mall which has plenty of shops and restaurants [Lucille's BBQ was delicious!!]. The room was perfect as mentioned by other reviewers. It was very clean, spacious and comfortable. There were two beds, a living room area with couch, chair, table and flat panel television. Also included is a breakfast/dinner nook area with fridge, microwave, table and chairs, perfect for morning coffee and breakfast or dinner. I also really appreciated the window in the bathroom, a small pleasure but nonetheless a pleasure. I also liked the large dressing room, big enough for an ironing board. Also there were plenty of electrical outlets for all your electrical devices. This was TERRIFIC as I had to plug in camera batteries, phones, mp3 players and a tablet. Of note; however, were the small beds. I am 5'10 and my feet came right to the edge of the bed. Anyone taller than that will have to sleep at an angle, no joke. The couch and chairs are also on a smaller scale. Fine for me but anyone larger might not be as comfortable. I did not try the pool, but it looked very inviting. I also did not try the limited breakfast. For breakfast try Norms on Pico Blvd or better yet, Pepe's Galley tucked away in the AMF Mar Vista Blowing Lanes on Venice Blvd. Breakfast was traditional but filling.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Trent C
Reviews.Content: My friends and i recently stayed here and i must say it was a excellent place to stay! Everything was clean and tidy, beds very comfortable, bathroom clean and motel facilities ticked all the boxes indeed. The superstart breakfast was awesome and after that a had a leisurely swim in the sparkling clean pool, staff are very friendly here and i can fully recommend this motel as a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Kept Secret in L.A.”
Reviews.Author: getbackzack
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this property for 6 nights and could not have enjoyed our stay more. This property is extremely clean and efficient - upon walking into our room for the first time, we were very impressed at the space and cleanliness with which we were provided. From the sheets to the bathroom, the room looked and felt cleaner than that of many other more expensive hotels. The only thing that I was disappointed in was the continental breakfast. There were a few packaged sweet rolls, but nothing outstanding was available. I would recommend walking to a nearby bakery or diner for breakfast - definitely a tasty option! Lastly, whenever we had questions, the staff at the front desk were very kind and responsive to our needs. Overall, an excellent hotel at the perfect price.

Reviews.Title: “The place we'll always return to!”
Reviews.Author: CampAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, the pictures didn't wow me in the slightest. However, my husband did his research and found this to be the best price we were willing to spend and read many different reviews from different websites. I'm glad we chose it. First off, the receptionists are very friendly and knowledgeable. Everything went smooth and quick, was told about great places to eat and how to get to some of the site seeing places easily, and had great attitudes. Our room suprised me the most, it was up to date on the furniture, bedding, floors the whole lot. Everything was very clean and very presentable. There is a bathroom window that you really can see out of unless you wanting to look, but there isn't anything to see as it's just the back of some buildings. All the front windows will overlook the parking lot. The pool was kept very clean from what I noticed, they do have a snack machine nearby as well. If I had to make one suggestion about the whole thing, it would have been that I would have liked to have day curtains in the window. There were only black out curtains and if you wanted to have light come in, the whole world could easily look in. But that would be it. That and the horrible traffic that fills all the streets from the afternoon on. But that's pretty much to be expected around these parts. We ate at 2 of the places we were recommended, one across the street at an outdoor grill type place. Delicious food! The other was a Mexican restaurant around the corner next to a Chinese place. One plate would fill 2 people easily, the selection was great, the staff was very nice and on top of everything. A good place to have a drink and walk back to the hotel. The neighborhood was very safe, no problems whatsoever. The bus stop was just a block away that can take you down to Hollywood, every bus driver was just as nice and helpful as everyone we've been fortunate to talk to. Venice Beach is a straight shot down, not even 10 minutes. The Dollar Store was within a 5 minute walking distance, just incase you forgot anything. Lots of other stores and places to eat as well. The continental breakfast wasn't really anything to write about, it made up of 2 cereal types, some packaged pastries from Costco, orange juice, milk and coffee. Toast was also available, but only 3 tables to sit at so you might want to get there early if you would like to stay and eat comfortably. If we decide to come back to this area again, I will definitely be booking here!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected - You'll Be Suprised”
Reviews.Author: Steve-And-Barbara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a Motel 6 immediately before the Super 8, and the difference was astounding! The room was very big, bed was very comfortable, cable TV was fine, bathroom was a decent size and the location was very quiet. Room cleaned every day if we needed it to, and they replaced the coffee and toothbrush/toothpaste etc too if you wanted them to. Only a 5 minute drive to Venice Beach. Free Wifi as well, and it was fast too - would definitely stay here again if we were in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Decent motel”
Reviews.Author: lil_gala
Reviews.Content: The Super 8 didn't really live up to it's name. I would say it was more like the Average 8 or the Sub-Par 8. The room itself was clean, spacious and comfortable. There was a pool, but we never used it (went to the beach instead). Breakfast was basic: toast, orange juice, cereal and coffee. Everything a motel should be. But I was disappointed that the management decided to not inform us until we had arrived (and already paid regular price) that they were tearing up the entire parking lot and repaving it. Not cool. Also, housekeeping starts knocking on your door at 8. In the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Junkiep
Reviews.Content: One of the best places I stayed..Room was clean.bed was very comfortable..Internet was good..Service was very good..Bathroom was neat,good shower had hair dryer too..room looked ok from outside but was very good inside..will definitely recommend this place to others looking for a clean/peaceful place to stay in Santa Clara..

Reviews.Title: “Super(ior)8 !”
Reviews.Author: MegasVK
Reviews.Content: I spend 3 nights in May with my wife in Super 8 Culver city and we only have compliments for this motel. Great location, we had car and we felt like in the middle of everything, close to Santa monica beach where is great nightlife and shopping, Beverly hills and Hollywood are close, neighborhood is quiet and we felt absolute safe... check-in was quick, the staff is extremely friendly, i reserved five month advance and price was great deal. Room is very clean with everything you need from refrigerator, iron board, tv with free HBO programs, free parking, free wi-fi internet, light breakfast... motel has a nice swimming pool but it was not season time so it was cold for swimming... motel overcame my expectations and when we next time visit LA, Super 8 Culver city is our only choice !!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised. Better than I expected.”
Reviews.Author: bbkcollector
Reviews.Content: I needed a cheap hotel room while traveling to Santa Monica but did not want to pay much. However, I didn't want a flea-bag place either. I read the reviews on this place and decided to give it a try. To my surprise, it was better than I thought it would be. Mind you, it's 4 walls and a bed. No surprise there. However, the property was clean, well maintained, no graffiti anywhere. I walked into the room and took a deep whiff......clean! I didn't detect any old stale odors or chemical cleaning solvents. The room itself was nicely furnished with granite topped end tables, a nice dresser, comfortable lounge chair, desk and chair.....there was a small fridge and microwave, both impeccable. The entire room was nicely wall-papered. Very nice wood-beamed ceiling as well. Bed and pillows were comfortable and clean. Pillows were decent, not those crappy flat foam rubber types I've seen in some places. I slept well and there was no noise at all. I was here on a Tuesday night, so I don't know if that made a difference. My only complaint was the internet. It's free, but it's sloooow. It wouldn't hurt for the owner of this place to spend a few extra bucks to get faster broadband. It's not that much money any more. All in all, I was fairly impressed. Again, it's a Super 8 Motel, so not exactly resort style, but definitely much nicer than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant. Clean, comfy, good location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: gs2487
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling through the US for about 2.5 weeks now, and I've found that I prefer Super 8 over most other chains. Of all the Super 8's I've stayed at, this one is probably the best. The service here is excellent - the staff went out of their way to accommodate me, and to find a room for a second night when everything was booked solid. I showed up before check-in time, and was given a room right away, and stayed beyond check-out and stored my bags while I was out for the day. Upon returning, I needed to print some forms, and the staff let me work in the lobbey and printed my forms, even though I'd already checked out. The rooms are nicer than I expected and are quite large. Everything is clean and the location is great. If I had any complaints, it would be that the rooms can be dim and could benefit from additional lighting. Also, the included breakfast has a smaller selection than other motels (and other Super 8's) I've stayed at. Overall, a great stay for a reasonable price in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you want to be near to the airport but not at it.”
Reviews.Author: Sky30
Reviews.Content: We choose this motel as it was close to the airport but not at the airport. We wanted to stay somewhere where we would have access to shopping, supermarkets and restaurants. The rooms were very nice and price offered good value. I would recommend this for someone who wanted to stay near the airport. It tooks us just a few minutes to get to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Value, quiet, efficiency and unpretentious managment style all come together”
Reviews.Author: malouin1940
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel on a strictly cost/benefit analysis basis, believing that certain trade offs I was making (perhaps giving up a more central location) would be overridden by the excellent rate I received as an AARP member ($79/night with taxes), and the need to drive around LA anyway. I made a very wise decision. The entire room was impeccably clean, and kept that way throughout our stay. The cleaning staff should be commended for this. On the other hand, usually motivation for these kinds of tasks is top down and management must share with that kudo for exceptional cleanliness. Beyond that, I had a number of internal glitches with my lap top connecting to the WiFi network. The front desk showed a lot of patience in dealing with me and my problem until things went right, and they were just as patient in working with me on a minor reservation glitch, with a small amount of money in my favor! Breakfast was fine for the money, similarly simple in scope to a Fairfield Inn, and no complaints in that department, although we do like a coffee a bit stronger. All of the room's amenities were in excellent working order and, first and foremost, the king bed was as good as any in a Hyatt, Marriott or Hilton: I know, I have been there too. With a car rental, we were in striking distance of all the points we wanted to visit so the initial choice of being in Culver City was mine, and besides, there are some very good to excellent restaurants in the area: try Yelp for a wide-ranging list. If we come back to Los Angeles again, I would not hesitate in staying here again and again: great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good value.”
Reviews.Author: phyhung
Reviews.Content: Good location, as it was only 1-2 miles from Venice Beach. Clean, comfortable, and spacious room. Only about US$71 per night before taxes. We occupied room #116, which was a 1 King Bed room. Free WiFi Internet service was quick and reliable. The only complaints would be that the showerhead and coffee pot could be a tad cleaner, and the fridge froze our fruit in the middle of the Min/Med setting, but nothing major. I would go back whenever I'm back in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to Recommend it”
Reviews.Author: lmarkman
Reviews.Content: I can't find any reason to recommend this motel. The property is not attractive. The rooms are not attractive. The staff is not friendly or helpful and the area surrounding the motel is devoid of interesting restaurants, shops or entertainment. The best I can say is that everything was in working order and the ugly carpet did not smell. Faint praise indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Better than what I thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: Garcas
Reviews.Content: Great hostel close to everywhere, specially venice beach and Hollywood. Not much to do in the neighbourhood at night, but there's a 99cent store which is very handy. Free parking, free internet. It's a cheap hostel and the girl in reception was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean - Incredible Value - Safe & Convenient Location To Explore LA & Beaches - Will Stay Again !”
Reviews.Author: gmanning50
Reviews.Content: (this review is based on a week's stay) First, our room was incredibly clean. We carry Clorox disinfectant wipes, and we wiped everywhere: door knobs, remote, countertops,nightstands, even the showerhead. Guess what showed up - NOTHING ! This place was spotless ! I even dropped something behind the refrigerator, and that's usually dusty and dirty. Even behind the fridge was spotless ! Hats off to the cleaning people - I wish my house was this clean ! After passing that test, everything else was easy. Here's what we got for $71. A comfortable bed and pillows, good sized, quiet room with a vaulted ceiling, a great tv with tons of choices, and with 6 HBO channels! A new microwave and small refrigerator/freezer, hairdryer, even an extra toothbrush/toothpaste, razor and gel awaited us (along with the standard shampoo/conditioner,coffee and maker). Even a laptop we could use in the lobby. And breakfast - we had a choice between 4 cereals, pastries, toast, english muffins, apple and orange juice, tea, coffee. A great way to start the day, with the sunshine waking us up while we ate. It's been years since we got so much for so little, especially in Los Angeles ! $71 for all this? I wouldn't have believed it. Like all of you who haven't been to LA before, we were concerned about the neighborhood. After staying there a week we can say we never felt uncomfortable at the motel or the area. In fact, Culver seemed very clean, quiet, and with some nice restaurants. Pitfire pizza has great food and fun atmosphere. IN n out burgers are a tradition in LA, but they're so-so. The fries are what really stood out, like fresh potatoes. There's even a COSTCO a mile away. What a great location to explore from. Just a few minutes from the beach, Hollywood, Rodeo Drive, Venice, anywhere you want to go. Just go during non rush hours to cross the city to Griffith Park, Glendale, Pasadena, etc. The staff was great as well, very responsive. The only problem we had was with a bad iron and they replaced it immediately. If only our future stays at other hotels could be this nice !We stayed at this Super 8 for the entire week in LA, and couldn't have been more pleased with the accomodations, the staff, the location, the amenities, the incredible value (w/ AAA we paid $71/night). If we had another 7 days we'd have stayed here, that's how much we liked it. We usually stay at Marriott Courtyards, places like that. This was just as nice if not better. But all our fears and anxiety about where and what we stayed in were gone after the first night. If you're going to explore LA for a vacation, I can't imagine finding a better value/location than this Culver City gem. Oh, and FREE PARKING ! At $20+/day at other places, that adds up fast. ps, we didn't realize that Super 8 is part of Wyndham hotels, so you can add points to your Wyndham account if you have one.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, Yes, Yes, this is the place you want in LA.”
Reviews.Author: Bolotet
Reviews.Content: Most important thing about this hotel: if you are thinking this area is not good to explore LA, you are probably wrong. We find very easy to move around, is closer than we thought from places like Hollywood Boulevard, Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, Venice Beach, Observatory, Downtown, etc. Hotel is located in a safe neighbourhood, plenty of fast food restaurants around and other facilities. Rooms are great for a "motel style" premises, you definitely won´t be dissapointed. We have stayed in other motels in LA during the same vacation (because Super 8 had no availability), they were more expensive and not so nice. In two words: very recommended if you have a car (totally necessary for this place).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, especially for the budget traveler!”
Reviews.Author: perfectly_cromulent3
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are definitely 'travelers on a budget'. We both thought this was a really great hotel. The room had a microwave, refrigerator, wi-fi, etc. We stayed here for 4 nights, which is enough time to get a very realistic impression of a place. The room was clean and quite comfortable. The hotel was booked solid, but you wouldn't know it by how nice and quiet it was every night. The folks who worked there were friendly and helpful. There are good restaurants and at least one bar within easy walking distance. Had a great breakfast at a Mexican place a couple blocks away. Fantastic drinks and Korean BBQ tacos at Alibi Room down the street. Yum! We would stay here again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “A super motel in a super location”
Reviews.Author: Poundhappy
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little motel. Friendly and helpful staff and always happy to lend me their laptop! Check in was smooth (even though we arrived late at night). The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The beds were really comfy (I've come home and decided I need to now buy myself a new mattress). The rooms were fairly dark, but this was good the sun didn't wake you up early and I guess helps to keep the rooms cool in summer. The pool was nice, although we didn't use it as it was too cold. Breakfast was a sufficient for me - cereals, muffins and pastries - and a welcome start to the day. Staff were always on hand to re-fill things as they run low. The location was ideal for exploring LA. The area felt safe and fairly quiet too. There are some shops and eating places within walking distance (there is a $store a few mins walk away, which is really handy if you want bits to put in the fridge or microwave). I would use this motel again as its excellent value for more than adequate facilites and a super base for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “clean and quite spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Oszusty
Reviews.Content: we spent there 4 nights just after arrival to LA. Easy check-in, room was clean, with new carpet, bed was comfortable. Good location as it's just about 10-15 min drive from Venice Beach, Marina del Rey, Santa Monica. But if you are looking for any entertainment in hotel nearby u will be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a 2-star”
Reviews.Author: Paulofsf
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in LA between two different Super 8's, and this one was much better than the other. Room was clean, bed was comfortable, not much noise. The location was good for UCLA - maybe a 10 minute drive on surface roads. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: AnyutaBK
Reviews.Content: This motel is a great value. It is not a luxury hotel, but for the $79 we paid to stay there, we were completely satisfied. The room was spacious, with a fridge, coffeemaker, microwave, ironing board, etc... included. The bathroom was fairly new and very clean, and the bed was large and comfortable. Breakfast is a simple affair (coffee/tea, oj, cereal, and some danishes/muffins), but sufficient to get going for the day. I am a very finnicky/light sleeper, and I slept well here and felt that the room was very quiet. The free parking is a bonus, and the motel is only a ten minute drive from Venice, and a 15-20 minute drive to LAX. The neighborhood itself is somewhat bland, but relatively safe and close to everything. Like I said, this is not a luxury hotel, but it is a great value and is well-managed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Bekm5
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. Free parking and not to far a drive from major attractions like Hollywood, Santa Monica etc. I recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rogerl53
Reviews.Content: We stayed for about 8 nights at this Super 8. It is a Pride of Super 8 hotel, and it shows. They earn the rating. The room was exceptionally clean, one of the cleanest I've ever seen, and the staff were are friendly and helpful, even at the late-night hours. The location is good, about a mile and a half from Venice Beach and less than that from Marina Del Rey. Depending on traffic it is 15 minutes to 30 minutes from LAX. Ramps to the 405 are fairly close, so it doesn't take long to get to where you are going, at least in Los Angeles terms. The location seems to be safe, and for the most part, quiet even though it could be considered a high-traffic area. Restaurants and shopping, including a Costco, are nearby, The hotel is well maintained and the grounds crew were busy taking care of the landscaping and pool regularly. The cleaning staff know their stuff and were helpful if we needed something. If there are any draw backs it is that the breakfast is very simple. This isn't a complaint, but if somebody is expecting a big spread with fancy pastry this isn't the place. There are a couple kinds of cereal, milk, juice, coffee, some packaged sweets, and bread for toast. Nobody will starve. Besides, the price is good and includes wireless Internet at no charge. The fact is, we have stayed in several hotels in that part of town, and this one is high on our list for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bang For Your Buck”
Reviews.Author: jazzyjulz
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this budget motel on a Saturday night. The location was great for where I needed to be (Playa Vista, Culver City, Beverly Hills) and it was clean--which is very important to me. Safety is important too and staying as a single female I felt safe. I was on the bottom floor near the pool in room 109 and I didn't have a problem with noise. Continental breakfast is a very loose term and for this establishment it meant cereal, english muffins, danish, tea, coffee, juice, and milk. No fruit. The free breakfast was sufficient, and got me going for the day. They also offer free Wi Fi, which was nice. I would definitely stay here again, as it was a really great bargain at less than $90 out the door on a Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “A room for $9.95 after tax in LA? Yeah, there's a catch... but read on!”
Reviews.Author: BrutalNick
Reviews.Content: I won one of those $8.88 rooms through Super 8's online promotion. Carefully selecting my one and only night in LA on a trip out to Las Vegas, I did a Google Street-View and looked around this place. It's right across from Sony Picture Studios in what looks to be an up and coming neighborhood. We arrived there, expecting them to laugh in our faces due to the rate that we booked the best room in the motel at, and the service was PHENOMENAL. Our room was ready early. When I mentioned that I won the promotion online, the girl behind the counter (who was also attractive hubba hubba) she perked up even more. "That's great! We'll I'm sure you'll love the room". It was clean, quiet, and way beyond what I expected. A good first LA experience. Too bad that I picked up a flu bug or cold on my way from Vegas to LA and was kinda sick =( Mere miles from BEAUTIFUL Venice Beach. I wouldn't hesitate to pay full price at this place again. A+ location, can't say enough good about the place. Oh yeah, AND they had free wireless. Are you kidding me? A++++++++

Reviews.Title: “decent stay”
Reviews.Author: marzc
Reviews.Content: The place was clean, safe, and friendly. The beds were a little hard, but relatively comfortable. The continental breakfast was adequate. Overall pretty good, and the place was a few miles from Venice beach which is rather convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: red1962
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Super 8 Motel because its location is close to the beaches in California. It is very convenient to Venice Beach and only a short drive to the Santa Monica Pier. The location of the motel is a little tricky to find. Follow the Washington signs carefully as there is a Washington Blvd. and a Washington Place crossing each other. It is easy to get turned around. The front desk staff was unfriendly. They were not able to accommodate our family (with our disabled son) in a first floor room as we had requested and didn't seem to care. On the 2nd floor, we ended up in the room over the main office. The room was HUGE! Ask for it by name. The neighbourhood is not the nicest but we felt pretty safe. I must admit that I looked outside first thing in the morning to make sure our rental car was still there. There are pop machines on site and a lovely little pool. The room was clean and the shower pressure was adequate. The beds were comfortable as well. I wouldn't stay there a week but for a day or two, it it satisfactory.

HotelInfo.Name: Super 8 Los Angeles / Culver City Area
HotelInfo.Address: 12664 W. Washington Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90066
